
\color{blue}

**Solution**

Null and alternative hypotheses are
$$
\begin{aligned}
H_0: \beta_4 = 0 \\
H_a: \beta_4 \ne 0
\end{aligned}
$$
Write the sample model as $\vec{y}=\mat{X}\vec{b}+\vec{e}$ with $\vec{b}=(b_0,b_1,b_2,b_3,b_4)$. Then, $\vec{b}=(\mat{X}^\transpose\mat{X})^{-1}\mat{X}^\transpose \vec{y}$ and the usual test statistic is $b_4$.

\color{black}
